arm_group.description: Nutritional education on sodium restriction diet.

brief_summary.textblock:
Excess dietary sodium can lead to poor outcomes, such as hypertension, edema and increased
      risk for cardiovascular diseases. These complications are associated with end stage renal
      disease (ESRD) progression and mortality in renal patients. This study aims to evaluate the
      effects of nutritional counseling restricting dietary sodium and its relation to clinical
      and diet factors, nutritional knowledge and quality of life in hemodialysis patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dietary Sodium Restriction in Hemodialysis Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical stable patients on dialysis for at least 3 months, over 18 years old, of
             both sexes, who agree to participate in the study.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with low cognitive ability, psychiatric disorders, with acute or infectious
             disease.

facility.name: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Dietary Sodium Restriction in Hemodialysis Patients: Randomized Clinical Trial

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.description: Sodium intake will be evaluated by food record and a food frequency questionnaire.
Quality of life will be evaluated by the Brazilian Portuguese version of the Kidney Disease and Quality-of-Life Short-Form (KDQOL-SF) questionnaire.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Will be considered the amount of weight gain between 2 dialysis sessions.

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
